result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Anthony Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Continue with AODA treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety,  Disclose to any physician your drug history/dependency.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ryan Anthony Young in court with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 5.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 dismissed and read in.  Recommendations by the State.  Statements by J.Y., L.Y., and T.P.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.  

Court orders the following:

Count 1:
- Total sentence: 6 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years) CONCURRENT with Count 5.  STAYED.  Credit for 37 days if revoked.
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $268.00; cash bail to be applied.  Any remaining costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00; cash bail to be applied.  Any remaining surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  No contact with codefendants.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Continue with AODA treatment/counseling.  Disclose to any physician your drug history/dependency.
CONDITION TIME: 6 months jail.  First 90 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - CONCURRENT with condition time in Count 5.  To commence July 20, 2015 by 6:00 pm.  Remainder of condition time STAYED for use by Agent.

Count 5:
-6 months Huber with standard release conditions CONCURRENT with Count 1. STAYED.  Credit for 37 days if revoked.
- 1 year Probation
-16 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 16 months Ignition Interlock on any vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant 
- Alcohol Assessment
- Fine of $1,214.00; cash bail to be applied.  Any remaining fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha Police Department
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1.
CONDITION TIME: 45 days- NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - CONCURRENT with condition time in Count 1.  To commence July 20, 2015 by 6:00 pm.
Sentencing Memorandum submitted by Attorney Dorlack.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
